comments:
The following problem was reported in the newsgroup and needs a bugzilla:

I detected the following error when reloading a resource with the
generated editor:

I start with the Schema

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xsd:schema targetNamespace="http://www.montages.com/tests/TestInheritance"
        xmlns:ecore="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/Ecore"
        xmlns:test="http://www.montages.com/tests/TestInheritance" 
        xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
        >
        
        <xsd:complexType name="C" abstract="true"/>

         <xsd:complexType name="C1">
            <xsd:complexContent>
                <xsd:extension base="test:C">
                    <xsd:sequence>
                        <xsd:element name="cContainment" type="test:C"
maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"  />
                        <xsd:element name="cReference" type="xsd:anyURI"
ecore:reference="test:C" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"  />
                    </xsd:sequence>
                   <xsd:attribute type="xsd:string" name="c1Id" />
                </xsd:extension>
            </xsd:complexContent>
        </xsd:complexType>
        
       <xsd:complexType name="C2">
            <xsd:complexContent>
                <xsd:extension base="test:C">
                    <xsd:sequence>
                        <xsd:element name="cContainment" type="test:C"
maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"  />
                        <xsd:element name="cReference" type="xsd:anyURI"
ecore:reference="test:C" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="0"  />
                    </xsd:sequence>
                   <xsd:attribute type="xsd:string" name="c2Id" />
                </xsd:extension>
            </xsd:complexContent>
        </xsd:complexType>
   
        
</xsd:schema>


And generate all from it. With the generted editor I create the following
document:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ASCII"?>
<inheritance:C1 xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xmlns:inheritance="http://www.montages.com/tests/TestInheritance" c1Id="a">
  <cContainment xsi:type="inheritance:C2" c2Id="b">
    <cContainment xsi:type="inheritance:C1" c1Id="c">
      <cContainment xsi:type="inheritance:C2" c2Id="d"/>
    </cContainment>
  </cContainment>
</inheritance:C1>


with other words, I used only the containment references. Everything works
perfectly, I can choose between C1 and C2, I can store and reopen the
editor.

However, when I use the references and create the following doc:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ASCII"?>
<inheritance:C1 xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xmlns:inheritance="http://www.montages.com/tests/TestInheritance" c1Id="a">
  <cContainment xsi:type="inheritance:C2" c2Id="b">
    <cContainment xsi:type="inheritance:C1" c1Id="c">
      <cContainment xsi:type="inheritance:C2" c2Id="d">
        <cReference>#/</cReference>
      </cContainment>
      <cReference>#//@cContainment/@cContainment/@cContainment</cReference>
    </cContainment>
    <cReference>#//@cContainment/@cContainment</cReference>
  </cContainment>
  <cReference>#//@cContainment</cReference>
</inheritance:C1>

everything works well creating and saving it with the generated editor.
Then I clase the workbench with the generated editor, and reopen it.
As soon as I try to open the doc again with the generated editor, I get
the following error. (at the end)

If someone could help me would be great. We depend on using the generated 
editor, and we depend on the possibility to use inheritance in the schemas.
It seems that for containment everything works well, but there is a bug
in the reference implementation.

Best Regards, Philipp
